workflow.name: Bulk verify WhatsApp numbers using Rapiwa API and Google Sheets
workflow.description:
# WhatsApp Bulk Number Verification in Google Sheets Using Unofficial Rapiwa API

## Who‚Äôs it for
This workflow is for marketers, small business owners, freelancers, and support teams who want to automate WhatsApp messaging using a Google Sheet without the official WhatsApp Business API. It‚Äôs suitable when you need a budget-friendly, easy-to-maintain solution that uses your personal or business WhatsApp number via an unofficial API service such as Rapiwa.

## How it works / What it does
- The workflow looks for rows in a Google Sheet where the `Status` column is `pending`.
- It cleans each phone number (removes non-digits).
- It verifies the number with the Rapiwa verify endpoint (`/api/verify-whatsapp`).
- If the number is verified:
  - The workflow can send a message (optional).
  - It updates the sheet: `Verification = verified`, `Status = sent` (or leaves `Status` for the send node to update).
- If the number is not verified:
  - It skips sending.
  - It updates the sheet: `Verification = unverified`, `Status = not sent`.
- The workflow processes rows in batches and inserts short delays between items to avoid rate limits.
- The whole process runs on a schedule (configurable).

## Key features
- Scheduled automatic checks (configurable interval; recommended 5‚Äì10 minutes).  
- Cleans phone numbers to a proper format before verification.  
- Verifies WhatsApp registration using Rapiwa.  
- Batch processing with limits to control workload (recommended max per run configurable).  
- Short delay between items to reduce throttling and temporary blocks.  
- Automatic sheet updates for auditability (verified/unverified, sent/not sent).  

## Defaults recommended in this workflow
- Trigger interval: every 5‚Äì10 minutes (adjustable).  
- Max items per run: configurable (example: 200 max per cycle).  
- Delay between items: 2‚Äì5 seconds (example uses 3 seconds).  

## How to set up
1. Duplicate the sample Google Sheet: ‚û§ [Sample](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Ui4TzzI-Gq-bsEsrZELwW1Kyddw0IU9L1wxlHikktqw/edit?usp=sharing)  
2. Fill contact rows and set `Status = pending`. Include columns like `WhatsApp No`, `Name`, `Message`, `Verification`, `Status`.  
3. In n8n, add and authenticate a Google Sheets node pointed to your sheet.  
4. Create an HTTP Bearer credential in n8n and paste your Rapiwa API key.  
5. Configure the workflow nodes (Trigger ‚Üí Google Sheets ‚Üí Limit/SplitInBatches ‚Üí Code (clean) ‚Üí HTTP Request (verify) ‚Üí If ‚Üí Update Sheet ‚Üí Wait).  
6. Enable the workflow and monitor first runs with a small test batch.

## Requirements
- n8n instance with Google Sheets and HTTP Request nodes enabled.  
- Google Sheets OAuth2 credentials configured in n8n.  
- Rapiwa account and Bearer token (stored in n8n credentials).  
- Google Sheet formatted to match the workflow columns.

## Why use Rapiwa
- Cost-effective and developer-friendly REST API for WhatsApp verification and sending.  
- Simple integration via HTTP requests and n8n.  
- Useful when you prefer not to use the official WhatsApp Business API.  
Note: Rapiwa is an unofficial service ‚Äî review its terms and risks before production use.

## How to customize
- Change schedule frequency in the Trigger node.  
- Adjust maxItems in Limit/SplitInBatches for throughput control.  
- Change the Wait node delay for safer sending.  
- Modify the HTTP Request body to support media or templates if the provider supports it.  
- Add logging or a separate audit sheet to record API responses and errors.

## Best practices
- Test with a small batch first.  
- Keep the sheet headers exact and consistent.  
- Store API keys in n8n credentials (do not hardcode).  
- Increase Wait time or reduce batch size if you see rate limits.  
- Keep a log sheet of verified/unverified rows for troubleshooting.

## Example HTTP verify body (n8n HTTP Request node)
```json
{
  "number": "{{ $json['WhatsApp No'] }}"
}
```

## Notes and best practices
- Test with a small batch before scaling.
- Store the Rapiwa token in n8n credentials, not in node fields.
- Increase Wait delay or reduce batch size if you see rate limits or temporary blocks.
- Keep the sheet headers consistent; the workflow matches columns by name.
- Log API responses or errors for troubleshooting.

---

## Optional
- Add a send-message HTTP Request node after verification to send messages.  
- Append successful and failed rows to separate sheets for easy review.

## Support & Community

Need help setting up or customizing the workflow? Reach out here:

- WhatsApp: [Chat with Support](https://wa.me/8801322827799)  
- Discord: [Join SpaGreen Server](https://discord.gg/SsCChWEP)  
- Facebook Group: [SpaGreen Community](https://www.facebook.com/groups/spagreenbd)  
- Website: [SpaGreen Creative](https://spagreen.net)  
- Envato: [SpaGreen Portfolio](https://codecanyon.net/user/spagreen/portfolio)

workflow.name: WhatsApp Bulk Number Verification in Google Sheets Using Unofficial Rapiwa API

parameters.content:
# BWhatsApp Bulk Number Verification in Google Sheets Using Unofficial Rapiwa API

## Overview
This n8n workflow reads phone numbers from a Google Sheet, cleans and verifies them using the Rapiwa API, and writes verification results back to the sheet. It runs automatically on a schedule and uses batching and delays to avoid rate limits.

---

## What it does
- Reads rows from a Google Sheet where the Status column is empty or marked "pending".
- Cleans phone numbers (removes +, spaces, and non-digit characters).
- Verifies each number with Rapiwa (checks if number is on WhatsApp).
- If verified: marks the row as verified and can proceed to send messages.
- If not verified: marks the row as unverified and skips sending.
- Adds short delays and processes rows in batches to reduce throttling risk.

---

## Requirements
- n8n instance with Google Sheets and HTTP Request nodes available.
- Google Sheets OAuth2 credentials configured in n8n.
- Rapiwa account and Bearer YOUR_TOKEN_HERE (store as an n8n HTTP credential).
- A Google Sheet formatted as described below.

---

## Google Sheet format (recommended)

| WhatsApp No   | Name | Message | Verification | Status |
|---------------|------|---------|--------------|--------|
| 8801XXXXXXXXX | John | Hello   | *(empty)*    | pending|

Note: Use international format without "+" or spaces (e.g., 8801XXXXXXXXX). Set Status = pending to queue a row for processing.

---

## Setup in n8n ‚Äî quick steps
1. **Connect Google Sheets**
   - Add a Google Sheets node, authenticate, select the document and worksheet.
   - Configure it to read rows where Status is empty or equals "pending".

2. **Batch and loop**
   - Use SplitInBatches or Limit to process a small number of rows per run (e.g., 5 or 10).
   - Use a Loop or SplitInBatches node to iterate items one by one.

3. **Clean numbers**
   - Add a Code node to strip non-digit characters from the WhatsApp No field.

4. **Verify with Rapiwa**
   - Add an HTTP Request node:
     - Method: POST
     - URL: https://app.rapiwa.com/api/verify-whatsapp
     - Authentication: Bearer YOUR_TOKEN_HERE (use n8n HTTP credential)
     - Headers: Content-Type: application/json
     - Body (JSON):
```json
{
  "number": "{{ $json['WhatsApp No'] }}"
}
```

5. **Branch and update**
   - Add an If node to check the verify response (e.g., response.data.exists).
   - If verified: update the sheet row with Verification = verified and Status = sent (or leave for message node).
   - If unverified: update the sheet row with Verification = unverified and Status = not sent.

6. **Delay between sends**
   - Use a Wait node (e.g., 5 seconds) between items to reduce rate-limit issues.

---

## Notes and best practices
- Test with a small batch before scaling.
- Store the Rapiwa token in n8n credentials, not in node fields.
- Increase Wait delay or reduce batch size if you see rate limits or temporary blocks.
- Keep the sheet headers consistent; the workflow matches columns by name.
- Log API responses or errors for troubleshooting.

---

## Optional
- Add a send-message HTTP Request node (Rapiwa) after verification to send messages.
- Append successful and failed rows to separate sheets for auditing.

---

nodes.name: Fetch All Pending Contacts for Verifing
Change State of Rows in Checked

parameters.content:
## Trigger Every 10 Minute
- **Purpose:** Automatically starts the workflow every 10 minutes.
- **Setup:** No changes needed unless you want a different interval.
- **Note:** Make sure the schedule trigger node is enabled.

## Fetch All Pending Contacts for Verifing
- **Purpose:** Retrieves up to 200 contacts from your Google Sheet that need verification.
- **Setup:**  
  - Connect your Google Sheets OAuth2 credentials.  
  - Set the correct **Document ID** and **Sheet Name** for your contacts.  
  - Apply filters to select only rows where `WA Checked` is empty or false.

---

## & Limit
- **Purpose:** Limits the workflow to process a maximum of 200 contacts each run.
- **Setup:**  
  - Adjust the limit value if you want to process more or fewer contacts per run.

## Clean WhatsApp Number
- **Purpose:** Removes non-digit characters from the WhatsApp number.
- **Setup:**  
  - No configuration needed unless your data format changes.  
  - Custom JavaScript code is already included to clean numbers.

---

## & Verify WhatsApp Number Using Rapiwa
- **Purpose:** Calls the Rapiwa API to verify WhatsApp number existence.
- **Setup:**  
  - Add your Rapiwa API Bearer YOUR_TOKEN_HERE in the HTTP Request credentials.  
  - Confirm the POST URL and parameters are correct.

## Loop Over Items
- **Purpose:** Splits the contacts into batches for individual processing.
- **Setup:**  
  - No special config, but make sure batch size fits API rate limits and performance.

## If
- **Purpose:** Checks the API response to decide if the number exists or not.
- **Setup:**  
  - Ensure the condition matches the API response format (boolean true/false).

---

## & Set Status Verified
- **Purpose:** Marks numbers verified by the API as ‚ÄúVerified.‚Äù
- **Setup:**  
  - No config needed; just outputs status text for later use.

---

## & Set Status Unverified
- **Purpose:** Marks numbers not verified by the API as ‚ÄúUnverified.‚Äù
- **Setup:**  
  - No config needed; just outputs status text for later use.

## Change State of Rows in Checked
- **Purpose:** Updates the Google Sheet row to:  
  - Mark the contact as checked  
  - Update verification status  
  - Update cleaned WhatsApp number  
- **Setup:**  
  - Confirm the correct Document ID and Sheet Name.  
  - Map columns accurately (`WA Checked`, `Verified/Unverified`, `WhatsApp No`, `row_number`).

---

## Wait
- **Purpose:** Pauses the workflow for 3 seconds between batches to prevent rate limit issues.
- **Setup:**  
  - Adjust the wait time if needed based on your API‚Äôs rate limits.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
